problem_text: It costs US $205 to take the GRE test. ETS provides financial aid to those GRE applicants who prove economic hardship. Economic hardship refers to difficulty caused by having too little money or too few resources. Tom lives in a single-parent family. His dad has been out of work for more than a year.
predicates:
Cost(x, y) ::: It costs y to take test x.
GRE(x) ::: x is the GRE test.
Provides(x, y, z) ::: x provides y to z.
FinancialAid(x) ::: x is financial aid.
Applicant(x) ::: x is an applicant.
GREApplicant(x) ::: x is a GRE applicant.
Prove(x, y) ::: x proves y.
EconomicHardship(x) ::: x is economic hardship.
RefersTo(x, y) ::: x refers to y.
Difficulty(x) ::: x is a difficulty.
CausedBy(x, y) ::: x is caused by y.
HavingTooLittleMoney(x) ::: x is having too little money.
HavingTooFewResources(x) ::: x is having too few resources.
LivesIn(x, y) ::: x lives in y.
SingleParentFamily(x) ::: x is a single-parent family.
Person(x) ::: x is a person.
Dad(x, y) ::: x is the dad of y.
OutOfWork(x, y) ::: x has been out of work for y.
Year(x) ::: x is a year.
Tom(x) ::: x is Tom.

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Tom is a GRE applicant and his economic hardship is caused by having too little money or too few resources.
tests.conclusions: ∃x ∃y ∃z (Tom(x) ∧ Applicant(x) ∧ GRE(y) ∧ Cost(y, z) ∧ EconomicHardship(x) ∧ CausedBy(x, z)) ::: Tom is a GRE applicant and the cost of the GRE test is a cause of his economic hardship. FALSE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? If Tom is a GRE applicant and his dad has been out of work for more than a year, then ETS provides financial aid to Tom.
tests.conclusions: GREApplicant(tom) ∧ OutOfWork(dad, year1) → ∃x (FinancialAid(x) ∧ Provides(ets, x, tom)) ::: TRUE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? If Tom is a GRE applicant and he lives in a single-parent family, then Tom is provided financial aid by ETS.
tests.conclusions: (GREApplicant(tom) ∧ SingleParentFamily(tom)) → ∃x ∃y (Provides(ets, x, tom) ∧ FinancialAid(x) ∧ RefersTo(x, y) ∧ EconomicHardship(y)) ::: FALSE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Tom is a GRE applicant and his dad has been out of work for more than a year, and he is a single parent family.
tests.conclusions: ∃x ∃y ∃z (Tom(x) ∧ LivesIn(x, z) ∧ SingleParentFamily(z) ∧ GREApplicant(x) ∧ Dad(y, x) ∧ OutOfWork(y, year1) ∧ ∼Provides(ETS, FinancialAid, x)) ::: Tom is a GRE applicant and his dad has been out of work for more than a year, and he is a single parent family. FALSE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? ETS provides financial aid to Tom if Tom is a GRE applicant and proves economic hardship due to having too little money.
tests.conclusions: GRE(gre) ∧ Cost(gre, 205) ∧ Applicant(tom) ∧ GREApplicant(tom) ∧ (EconomicHardship(tom) ↔ (Difficulty(tom) ∧ (CausedBy(tom, HavingTooLittleMoney(tom)) ∨ CausedBy(tom, HavingTooFewResources(tom))))) ∧ LivesIn(tom, SingleParentFamily) ∧ (∃x (Dad(x, tom) ∧ OutOfWork(x, Year1))) → (GREApplicant(tom) ∧ EconomicHardship(tom) ∧ CausedBy(tom, HavingTooLittleMoney(tom))) → Provides(ets, FinancialAid, tom) ::: TRUE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Tom is a GRE applicant and his economic hardship is caused by having too little money.

Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Tom is a GRE applicant, and ETS provides financial aid to Tom because Tom proves economic hardship, which is caused by having too few resources.
tests.conclusions: GREApplicant(tom) ∧ Provides(ETS, financialAid, tom) ∧ Prove(tom, economicHardship) ∧ CausedBy(economicHardship, HavingTooFewResources(economicHardship)) ::: TRUE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? If Tom is a GRE applicant and Tom lives in a single-parent family and his dad has been out of work for more than a year, then Tom is provided financial aid by ETS because he proves economic hardship.
tests.conclusions: (GREApplicant(tom) ∧ SingleParentFamily(tom) ∧ ∃y (Dad(tom, dad) ∧ OutOfWork(dad, y) ∧ Year(y))) → ∃x (Provides(ets, x, tom) ∧ FinancialAid(x) ∧ Prove(tom, EconomicHardship(tom))) ::: FALSE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Tom is a GRE applicant, and his economic hardship is caused by having too little money or too few resources.

Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Tom is a GRE applicant and proves economic hardship because he has too little money and his dad has been out of work for more than a year.
tests.conclusions: GREApplicant(tom) ∧ Prove(tom, EconomicHardship(tom)) ∧ CausedBy(EconomicHardship(tom), HavingTooLittleMoney(tom)) ∧ OutOfWork(DadOfTom, Year) ::: Tom is a GRE applicant and proves economic hardship because he has too little money and his dad has been out of work for more than a year. FALSE

candidate_solutions.text:
# Predicates:
Cost(x, y) ::: It costs y to take test x.
GRE(x) ::: x is the GRE test.
Provides(x, y, z) ::: x provides y to z.
FinancialAid(x) ::: x is financial aid.
Applicant(x) ::: x is an applicant.
GREApplicant(x) ::: x is a GRE applicant.
Prove(x, y) ::: x proves y.
EconomicHardship(x) ::: x is economic hardship.
RefersTo(x, y) ::: x refers to y.
Difficulty(x) ::: x is a difficulty.
CausedBy(x, y) ::: x is caused by y.
HavingTooLittleMoney(x) ::: x is having too little money.
HavingTooFewResources(x) ::: x is having too few resources.
LivesIn(x, y) ::: x lives in y.
SingleParentFamily(x) ::: x is a single-parent family.
Person(x) ::: x is a person.
Dad(x, y) ::: x is the dad of y.
OutOfWork(x, y) ::: x has been out of work for y.
Year(x) ::: x is a year.
Tom(x) ::: x is Tom.

# Premises:
Cost(gre, 205USD) ::: It costs US $205 to take the GRE test.
∀x (GREApplicant(x) ∧ Prove(x, EconomicHardship(x)) → Provides(ets, FinancialAid(x), x)) ::: ETS provides financial aid to those GRE applicants who prove economic hardship.
∀x (EconomicHardship(x) ↔ (Difficulty(x) ∧ CausedBy(x, HavingTooLittleMoney(x)))) ::: Economic hardship refers to difficulty caused by having too little money.
∀x (EconomicHardship(x) ↔ (Difficulty(x) ∧ CausedBy(x, HavingTooFewResources(x)))) ::: Economic hardship refers to difficulty caused by having too few resources.
Tom(tom) ::: Tom is Tom.
LivesIn(tom, singleParentFamily) ::: Tom lives in a single-parent family.
∃x (Dad(x, tom) ∧ OutOfWork(x, year_more_than_one)) ::: His dad has been out of work for more than a year.

# Predicates:
Cost(x, y) ::: It costs y to take test x.
GRE(x) ::: x is the GRE test.
Provides(x, y, z) ::: x provides y to z.
FinancialAid(x) ::: x is financial aid.
Applicant(x) ::: x is an applicant.
GREApplicant(x) ::: x is a GRE applicant.
Prove(x, y) ::: x proves y.
EconomicHardship(x) ::: x is economic hardship.
RefersTo(x, y) ::: x refers to y.

CausedBy(x, y) ::: x is caused by y.
HavingTooLittleMoney(x) ::: x is having too little money.
HavingTooFewResources(x) ::: x is having too few resources.
LivesIn(x, y) ::: x lives in y.
SingleParentFamily(x) ::: x is a single-parent family.
Person(x) ::: x is a person.
Dad(x, y) ::: x is the dad of y.
OutOfWork(x, y) ::: x has been out of work for y.
Year(x) ::: x is a year.
Tom(x) ::: x is Tom.

# Premises:
Cost(GRE, 205USD) ::: It costs US $205 to take the GRE test.
∀x (GREApplicant(x) ∧ Prove(x, EconomicHardship(x)) → Provides(ets, FinancialAid(x), x)) ::: ETS provides financial aid to those GRE applicants who prove economic hardship.
RefersTo(EconomicHardship(x), Difficulty(x)) ∧ CausedBy(Difficulty(x), HavingTooLittleMoney(x)) ::: Economic hardship refers to difficulty caused by having too little money.
RefersTo(EconomicHardship(x), Difficulty(x)) ∧ CausedBy(Difficulty(x), HavingTooFewResources(x)) ::: Economic hardship refers to difficulty caused by having too few resources.
Tom(tom) ::: Tom is Tom.
LivesIn(tom, SingleParentFamily(singleParentFamily)) ::: Tom lives in a single-parent family.
∃y ∃x (Dad(x, tom) ∧ OutOfWork(x, year_more_than_one)) ::: His dad has been out of work for more than a year.

∀x (GREApplicant(x) ∧ Prove(x, EconomicHardship(x)) → Provides(ets, FinancialAid(x), x)) ::: ETS provides financial aid to any GRE applicant who proves economic hardship.
∀x (EconomicHardship(x) ↔ RefersTo(x, Difficulty(x))) ::: Economic hardship is defined as a difficulty.
∀x ∀y (RefersTo(x, Difficulty(x)) ∧ CausedBy(x, y) ∧ (y = HavingTooLittleMoney(y) ∨ y = HavingTooFewResources(y))) ::: A difficulty is caused by either having too little money or having too few resources.

∃x (Dad(x, tom) ∧ OutOfWork(x, Year(year_more_than_one))) ::: Tom has a dad who has been out of work for more than a year.

validation.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true, false, or uncertain? Tom can apply for financial aid from ETS to take the GRE test.
validation.conclusions: Tom → GREApplicant(Tom) ∧ Prove(Tom, EconomicHardship(Tom)) ∧ Provides(ETS, FinancialAid, Tom) ::: Tom can apply for financial aid from ETS to take the GRE test. true
